Spatial Activism Workshop

When

Symposium Sunday, April 16

Workshops + Hackathon Saturday, April 22 - Sunday, April 23rd

What

Even if it feels like our lives are governed at every scale by the ubiquity of digital media — tweets, emails, facebook posts, and snapchats — at the end of the day, our lived experiences are all about space. The spaces of a city, a park, a bathroom, a train station, a public square, a national border, an airport, a farm, a factory, a school, a warehouse, a church, a club: this is where life takes place, where inequalities occur, where politics begins, and where change can happen.

The Spatial Activism Workshop is a discussion series and workshop/hackathon weekend at the intersection of urbanism, activism, and technology. What political and social change can start at this intersection? What technologies can be active (or activist!) in helping address issues of spatial inequality, displacement, and access?

We are bringing together engaged, smart, and thoughtful people and organizations from many disciplines — architects, urbanists, technologists, lawyers, activists, non-profits, and historians. We start with a symposium on April 16, with presentations from brilliant folks working in the areas of design, urbanism, activism, and technology, and follow up the next weekend of April 22-23 with a series of workshops and a hackathon to see what we can build together.

Our goals are:

  • Build awareness of the issues and get people excited
  • Make action-oriented projects that address specific issues of space, social justice, and urbanism through technology
  • Connect networks together to foster collaboration / support

We're convinced that there's lots of potential at the intersection between urbanism, activism, and technology. We know that amazing things happen when we bring together the right ingredients, and we're excited to see what those things are. We're looking forward for you to join us!

Projects we like

These are projects we like and are inspired by, because they use technology to activate and energize activist efforts in a spatial realm:

  • 5 Calls: Make your voice heard
  • Am I Rent Stabilized?
  • Living Lots NYC
  • Million Dollar Blocks | SPATIAL INFORMATION DESIGN LAB
  • The Transborder Immigrant Tool
  • Eric Brelsford Portfolio
  • CUP: Making Policy Public

Ideas that Illustrate

Here are some ideas that illustrate what kind of intersections between urbanism, activism, and technology we're talking about.

  • Cell phone mesh networking for notification during protest of police aggression
  • Visualizer/notifier for corporate ownership of urban properties (e.g. this building you just entered/passed is owned by Kushner/Trump)
  • Rent transparency - like Payscale/Glassdoor for rent
  • App to map public spaces and POPS

Who's doing this?

Organizers

  • Dan Taeyoung
    • Dan Taeyoung is Adjunct Assistant Professor in Architecture at Columbia GSAPP. He works, teaches, and plays at the intersection of architecture, technology, and community.
  • Andrew Heumann
    • Andrew Heumann is a Design Technology Specialist at Woods Bagot, where he develops custom software tools for design teams.
